organic.title: Vintage Button Guide: Ways to Identify Antique Buttons - HobbyLark
organic.snippet: One way is to look at the material in or around the shank or buttonholes. You can sometimes see unprocessed materials in or around these holes.

organic.title: Button Identification - Agnes' Vintage World
organic.snippet: Button identification is crucial to its dating. The state of the buttons can be misleading, as the colour can be very well preserved.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you identify old flat buttons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Flat button vintage colonial metal button identification can easily be done from the back by looking at the seam. Sometimes, military, political or other official buttons from this time period could have a rim, or the centre could be formed around a pin.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Flat Button Vintage Colonial Metal Buttons Identification [Details]

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to tell if buttons are bakelite?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Rub the piece with your thumb until it becomes warm and give it a sniff. If it is Bakelite, it will give off the chemical scent of formaldehyde. This test has worked on every piece in my collection, although some older pieces or black jewelry needs a bit more rubbing before it works.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Identify Bakelite / Va-Voom Vintage | Vintage Fashion, Hair Tutorials and DIY Style

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify vintage mother of pearl buttons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Mother of pearl buttons have more depth of color than plastic buttons. It takes a look to tell them from any other buttons due to their noble opalescent sheen.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Mother of Pearl Buttons - Tissura
